Class DayPlanner

  • public class DayPlanner
extends java.lang.Object
    Main Class which runs the program.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DayPlanner

        public DayPlanner()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main function which operates the control loop for the DayPlanner program, allowing the use to add new activities, and search for existing activities. This function creates the arrays to hold the different activities as well as iterators to keep track of the elements in the array.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments

      • menu

        public static char menu()
        Displays a menu with options: Add Search Quit and returns a character representing the user's selected choice. 'a' for Add 's' for Search 'q' for Quit
        Returns:
        character representing the user's choice

      • newHomeActivity

        public static HomeActivity newHomeActivity()
        Gets the input required to construct a HomeActivity class, creates the class, and returns it to the user
        Returns:
        a new HomeActivity class

      • newSchoolActivity

        public static SchoolActivity newSchoolActivity()
        Gets the input required to construct a SchoolActivity class, creates the class, and returns it to the user
        Returns:
        a new SchoolActivity class

      • newOtherActivity

        public static OtherActivity newOtherActivity()
        Gets the input required to construct a OtherActivity class, creates the class, and returns it to the user
        Returns:
        a new OtherActivity class

      • newTime

        public static Time newTime()
        Gets input from the user required to create a new Time class, then constructs the class and returns it to the user. All input is check to ensure it is within a valid range for the respective variable. For example month must be within 1-12.
        Returns:
        a new Time class

      • getActivityType

        public static char getActivityType(boolean empty)
        Gets the user to select an activity type, and returns it as a character of the first letter of the activity type. If empty is true this function will also accept empty input. For example: 'h' for home 's' for school 'o' for other 'newline' for empty
        Parameters:
        empty - whether or not the function is allowed to accept empty input
        Returns:
        character representing the user's choice

      • doSearch

        public static void doSearch()
        Search through MyArrayList myList for activities. The user can select one or more search types. Search types: keywords time activity type Activities which match ALL selected search parameters will be printed out.

      • loadListFromFile

        public static void loadListFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Opens a file "fileName" and reads through it line by line, extracting Activity data and adding them to MyArrayList myList.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the full path of a file from which to load Activities

      • addToHashMap

        public static void addToHashMap(java.lang.String title,
                                int key)
        Adds each word in the string "title" to the HashMap searchMap. If the particular word already exists in the HashMap, add the key to it's MyArrayList value. If a particular word does not exist in the HashMap add a new entry.
        Parameters:
        title - String containing the title of an Activity.
        key - integer which represents the Activity which the title belongs to position within MyArrayList myList.

      • printHashMap

        public static void printHashMap()
        Debug function which prints out the hash map in the format: keyword, [ # # # ] where keyword is a string, and the # are all the positions in myList of Activities which contain the word.

      • printListToFile

        public static void printListToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Prints each Activity in MyArrayList myList to a file "fileName".
        Parameters:
        fileName - String containing a path to a file. If it does not already exist it will be created by this method.
